title: 107_hr2258
content: The Women Immigrants Safe Harbor Act of 2001 allows certain aliens suffering from domestic abuse to be eligible for public benefits. The Women Immigrants Safe Harbor Act of 2001 provides exemptions for battered aliens from bans on receiving benefits under specified federal programs. The Women Immigrants Safe Harbor Act of 2001 amends the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 to provide exemptions for battered aliens from bans on receiving federal benefits. The Women Immigrants Safe Harbor Act of 2001 amends the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 to expand the definition of battered aliens for exemptions from federal benefit bans. The Women Immigrants Safe Harbor Act of 2001 expands the definition of battered aliens for exemptions from federal benefit bans. It includes provisions for determining if benefits would alleviate harm from battery or extreme cruelty. Amendments are made to ensure benefits address past harm and prevent future harm. Amendments are made to the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 to include nonimmigrant "U" visa holders as qualified aliens. The definition of "Family" used in laws granting benefits is also being conformed. Amendments to the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 include nonimmigrant "U" visa holders as qualified aliens. The definition of "Family" used in laws granting benefits is being conformed. The amendments to the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 now include nonimmigrant "U" visa holders as qualified aliens. The definition of "Family" used in laws granting benefits is being adjusted. The Public Charge Provisions of Section 212 of the INA are amended to exclude certain aliens described in section 431(c) of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996. The Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 amended the benefits provided to battered aliens, excluding certain aliens described in section 431(c) of the Act. The Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 is amended to include benefits for specific categories of aliens, effective for public benefits provided after the enactment of the Act.
